Posts.Content: baridirects wrote: Hello, everyone! Just a little background...I was first diagnosed with Stage IIIc ILC in February 2013, and had a full course of treatment.  I was found to have bone mets after a routine set of interval blood work showed an elevated CA 15-3. My oncologist immediately switched me from tamoxifen to Femara, Faslodex, and Xgeva.  Repeat blood work done a couple of days ago show a further rise in the CA 15-3 (my CEA is normal, as are the rest of my results, except for a low platelet count).  Has anyone else had this happen?  I believe my oncologist told me that it takes some time for the meds to kick in, but of course I'm very anxious.  I have no bone pain or other symptoms. Thanks for your input- Christine Dx 2/26/2013, ILC, 5cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 19/19 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 4/21/2013 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 6/9/2013 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/9/2013 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 11/25/2013 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Concern about CA 15-3 tumor marker baridirects kayrnic
